title.narrative: OUTPUT 3 [ECD]

description.narrative: Output 3: By the end of 2019, health facilities in Mali and communities in Mopti and Sikasso regions have knowledge and capacities for psychosocial stimulation of under 36 months children., which contributes to Early Childhood Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: [Women and children's nutrition]: By the end of 2019, the nutritional status of children aged 0-59 months and women of childbearing age has improved, especially those living in areas with high prevalence of malnutrition, particularly Mopti and Sikasso.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3: By the end of 2019, health facilities in Mali and communities in Mopti and Sikasso regions have knowledge and capacitiesfor psychosocial stimulation of under 36 months children.

description.narrative: In 2019, in the regions of Mopti, Sikasso and Kayes, targeted communities offered an integrated nutrition and early child education to about 22,373 children under five years of age. Additionally, more than 48 per cent of parents are estimated to have adequate knowledge of early child development and care practices. In humanitarian context, a major achievement is the integration of early child stimulation into the management of acute malnutrition, which is increasingly effective in all health facilities and reached about 86,258 under-five children (43,992 girls), representing 45 per cent of the target. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:07/02/2020
